name: Who's Hacking What?
author: Michael Torbert

sections.description: This plugin gives multiple developers on a live site the ability to notify other if they are currently hacking any files. The notification is displayed on the front end in a draggable block for anyone logged in as an administrator. You may easily add hackers to the list or delete them via the wp-admin area.
sections.installation:
1. Upload whos-hacking-what.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
Where can I request help or additional features

The plugin’s homepage is located at FullThrottle Development’s Website
sections.changelog:
0.3

fixed post/db sanitization, fixed cap/role issue, should have fixed screenshots, updated licensing info, updated for 4.4

0.2

Fixed minor bugs, including bad link

0.1

Initial Release

short_description: A simple interface that notifies other administrators if you are hacking files on a live server.
description: This plugin gives multiple developers on a live site the ability to notify other if they are currently hacking any files. The notification is displayed on the front end in a draggable block for anyone logged in as an administrator. You may easily add hackers to the list or delete them via the wp-admin area.

upgrade_notice.0.3: fixed post/db sanitization, fixed cap/role issue, should have fixed screenshots, updated licensing info, updated for 4.4

screenshots.caption: Admin interface for adding / deleting hackers
Front end notification is draggable and changes color when the list is updated.
